alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 8:05PM CST until February 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tangipahoa River Near Robert affecting Tangipahoa Parish. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Bogue Falaya River At Boston St in Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. For the Tangipahoa River...including Osyka, Kentwood, Amite, Robert...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Bogue Falaya...including Camp Covington, Boston St in Covington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bogue Falaya River At Boston St in Covington. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, The river will leave its banks under the Boston Street Bridge and begin to flood the Bogue Falaya Towers property. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CST Thursday was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 2.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.5 feet on 05/22/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
